page.title: 04SOUTER LIGHTHOUSE.
page.content: SOUTER LIGHTHOUSE. Souter Point (sometimes called Lizard Point) is halfway between South Shields and Sunderland.It is a round tower with a red band and a red lantern. The tower is 23m high and the light is 46m above high water level.It has a 1st order biform single flashing optic driven by an electrical mechanism, with two sets of lenses. Souter light flashes four times every minute. A diaphone fog signal sounds one blast,lasting 2 seconds every 30 seconds. Four keepers are appointed to the station and maintain a 24 hour watch.
